PROJECTS

Reha

Reha is a mobile dating app based on astrological predictions and theory. A team project for a client based in USA for the Indian Market. The astrological calculations relied on a library designed by me ( npm link ). The application's system design and architecture was done by me and that involved setting up a PostgreSQL, Express, Firebase Authentication, Firebase Cloud Messaging, AWS S3, React Native Stack. The development part of this app was given to the junior developers in the team of which I was the lead of. The app is currently in beta and soon awaiting Full Production Rollout. Please click view to join the Beta Program and become a tester!

View

Parkpoolr

Was my first project as an intern doing React, ExpressJS, PostgreSQL, and Firebase Authentication. The application provides an interface to make renting your parking space when you're not using it available to others. The project comprised of an iOS User Facing Application, an Admin Panel and a CMS (called Host Panel). The iOS application was built using React Native, Featuring react-native-maps, Google Directions, Google Places APIs, etc. The project is in production (The app is for the USA Market, so it won't be visible in the Indian Version of the Apple App Store) App Store Link (For Americans) : ParkPoolr

View

ABOUT

Software Developer based in Bangalore. Currently a 4th year CS Student, studying in BITS Pilani, KK Birla Goa Campus and graduating in August 2021.

I have done multiple internships, first being in the Science Museum of BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus where I built a ChatBot which talks back to the visitors in their native language (Hindi). I used Google's DialogFlow API and ExpressJS and built a frontend for it using React-Electron and deployed it on a Raspberry Pi attatched to a USB microphone and an HDMI monitor. This project with the Birla Science Museum was in partial fulfillment of the PS-I course at BITS Pilani, Goa.

I have taken courses in my campus (BITS Pilani, Goa Campus) which involved React, NodeJS and MongoDB. The strength of the class was 50 and my first teaching experience.

My second internship was at Fountane based in Hyderabad, India. It was a wonderful experience where I made Parkpoolr using my knowledge of React, ExpressJS, PostgreSQL, Firebase Services. I had, as part of my interview and screening process, also helped in building Corbata, an Uber Like application and was involved in the backend where I had written the basis of the shortest path algorithm between user and driver, and also performed a migration of data from the older MongoDB stack to the newer PostgreSQL stack for speed improvements and scalability.

Shortly after my second internship, I got another opportunity to work with Caarya where I was at a senior level among the developers and I was heading multiple teams. Although this was part time (as I am still studying), the Corona Virus pandemic converted me to a fulltime developer where I actively participated in 7 projects (10Trove, Dhaatri, Rentyo, Reha, Raxa, Chronos, Design Storybook ). All of the projects mentioned previously, used either React, PostgreSQL, ExpressJS or used the Angular, PostgreSQL, ExpressJS stacks.

My fourth and last internship was at Megh Computing where I took up a different kind of problem as a challenge. The problem was to keep track of the warehouse items and the number of people entering and leaving the warehouse throughout the entirety of the day. The solution proposed was Computer Vision based and that is being built using Python and common computer vision deep learning models. The project involves a staged pipeline for detecting objects and keeping track of them and I have built all the pipeline stages. A browser tool which was also a requirement for the project for remote access to the server and some statistics is also being built by me. The project is an inhouse project as part of the internship for the company. This project is in partial fulfillment of the PS-II course offered at BITS Pilani, Goa Campus.

Other than the projects at internships, I have done a research project under the guidance of my networks programming teacher, Raj Kumar at BITS Pilani, Goa Campus. The title of the project was Using Deep Learning to guide Software Defined Networks. In this project I had to build a Deep Learning model with the data being provided by Raj Sir, using which the model could understand the various intricacies of the Software Defined Hosts, Software Defined Routers and Software Defined Sub Networks and easily adapt to give the least consumption of power while also taking into account Bandwidth and Congestion. The project involved building a network controller using the POX controller and a Tensorflow Model.

I have one personal project which took a long time to achieve with the help of some seniors we were able to get some data and few users onboarded. Ucadd is an online learning platform which has carefully curated videos, tons of questions and perfect analysis to help you guide your JEE (Joint Entrance Examination) preparation to the absolute next level.
